meanings.definition: The quality of a gemstone exhibiting a changeable luster or color when viewed from different angles.
meanings.sent1: The chatoyancy of the gemstone made it look like it was glowing from within.
meanings.sent2: Gem collectors admire the chatoyancy of certain stones for their unique beauty.
meanings.sent3: The jeweler joked that the chatoyancy of the gemstone was like having a tiny rainbow trapped inside.
meanings.sent4: The chatoyancy of the stone was so mesmerizing, it seemed to dance with light.
meanings.sent5: The chatoyancy of the gem was so striking that it caught everyone's eye in the room.

meanings.definition: The phenomenon of a material appearing to have a cat's eye effect when light is reflected off its surface.
meanings.sent1: The chatoyancy of the fabric made it seem like it had a hidden sparkle.
meanings.sent2: The chatoyancy of the material gave it a mysterious and alluring look.
meanings.sent3: The magician's cape had such strong chatoyancy that it seemed to follow you with its gaze.
meanings.sent4: The chatoyancy of the cloth was like a secret message that only revealed itself in certain light.
meanings.sent5: The chatoyancy of the fabric was so pronounced that it almost seemed alive with light.
